page.title: 03FARMING AROUND BRIDGE EARN
page.content: Most of the farms around Bridge of Earn were once owned by lairds living on large estates.Mr Johnson,who owns Hilton Farm was once a tenant of the Moncreiffe estate. In the old days when the farm was owned by the laird the farmer could grow as much produce as he wished,but today the government will only allow a certain amount to be grown each year.Mr Johnson is allowed to grow about 20 acres of potatoes a year and he would be heavily fined if he exceeded this limit.Also,the potatoes can only be grown in the same field every five years.When the potatoes are ready Mr Johnston hires a potato merchant to come and harvest them.The merchant brings his own labour force and takes the potatoes away to be sold.
